chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Abrianna P Marr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence in La Crosse County case 13CF805, with same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
An Alcohol and Drug Assessment has already been completed - def is to follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def to undergo Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

The def is not to be at any location where alcohol is sold or consumed

No Contact with users or dealers of illicit drugs or controlled substances, including Nathanial J., but PO can modify the No Contact with Nathanial J.
.

PO is to identify and prioritize any treatment needs and assessments

Participation in OWI Court Program on Ct 2 in 13CF805 is left up to discretion of the PO

Pay restitution and 10% surcharge as shown in 13CF805

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
The defendant is to be incarcerated until 5-31-15, which is to be served on Electronic Monitoring through Justice Sanctions.  The incarceration period will continue until 8-31-15, but the Court will give the def the option of applying for a curfew for the summer (5-31-15 to 8-31-15).

The def will be on House Arrest through the school year and will be allowed out for school, employment and counseling only.  If the def does well during the first semester, then the Court will lift the House arrest for the remaining period & the defendant will be on a curfew from 10pm to 6am, to be enforced by Electronic Monitoring through Justice Sanctions.
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence in La Crosse Co case 13CF805
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician
.

Pay Court costs/fees as originally orderred

Undergo any assessments or evaluations as deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

records.addlTxt: DRG CRT HOLD Order - Def to report to jail 8-17-16 at 10am & held until further order of CRT - signed by SLH  [filed in 13CF805]

Def w/Atty Geraldson
8/21 report of violations
CRT: EM is a privilege & not something the court had to give her. Rather than imposing time w/o release the court opted for EM, I believe there needs to be a punitive component in addition so she understands the importance of complying w/the cond. Court has authority to modify the terms. If she gets the idea that she can be free to violate the cond the court ordered, I believe the wrong message will be sent to her & inconsistent w/her rehab needs & the court will modify the cond to include 14 days CJ to be served on EM & if there are any more violations, the court can order for her to be confined w/o release. 7 days credit

Def N/A
Atty Geraldson doesn't represent her
Present 10:55
CRT: I believe the court has the authority to modify the terms & cond of probation or modification if deemed approp. I would have to be convinced taht there's a case that prevents a court from enforcing it's own order. If you want a chance to confer w/an atty before I make a decision on the imposition of the EM, I will vacate the order & set a hearing
Def: wants atty
CRT: vacate EM
Hearing: 9/17 @ 1:30

State by Skemp /  Def w/o Counsel
JSS VIOLATIONS
CRT:  your being off [bond] doesn't negate the violations that occurred while on EM.  The CRT has ability to modify the terms & conditions of probation & impose any other reasonable conditions
Def comments...I am back on JSS right now just for testing
CRT:  15 days EM added to the sentence - def to report to JSS immediately after CRT - House Arrest subject to rules of JSS.  Any more violations you will be locked up in jail w/o release.  I expect you to comply w/ rules & there will be consequences if you don't.  If I get any other reports of violations from JSS, you will go to jail.  You are very cavalier in compliance.  Maybe that's been a big part of your problem.  Many thousands of $ have been spent on you in trmt.  You have an I & S prison term if probation is revoked - you will be going to jail on one Count if not both.  THE 15 DAYS IS TO BE ADDED TO CT 1 IN 13CF805

State by Minser /  Def in custody w/ Atty Keith Belzer
CRT:  $2500 cash bond required (covers 14CF65, 14CF301 & 13CF805) w/ conditions:  No alcohol, drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription;  No bars or taverns;  Cannot operate motor vehicle;  Comply w/ JS conditions - house arrest w/ EM - def can only be out for school, employment, lawyer & doctor appts
NOTE THAT THE $5000 PREVIOUSLY POSTED WAS REFUNDED WHEN 14CF64 WAS DISMISSED & CLOSED OUT.  THE DEF NEEDS TO POST $10,000 FOR 14CF65, 14CF301 & 13CF805!!
Review on October 22, 2014 at 07:30 am.

3 pm Def in court w/ Atty Keith A Belzer.  Def in custody.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Belzer states there may be a problem with getting on the air plane with the em.  JS is thinking about turning the unit off before she gets on the plane and then turn it off when she gets off.  Dr. needs to review meds.  We'd ask if she could be released on house arrest on the 7th and then fly on July 9th.  Minser:  The Def's history on bond- I don't need to bring up the facts.   She was on em while on bond.  COURT:  You're asking that the cash be reduced to a $5,000 cash bond.  Address' Ms. Marr's mother and grandmother about the possiblity loosing the $5,000 if I go along with this request...  You're giving $5,000 for the treatment program and now $5,000 for bond.  Grandma says family has come up with the bond.  Ins. has reduced the program fee to $2,500.  They understand theossibility of loosing the bond money.  Mom:  She really, really needs this treatment.  I just have to believe in her.  Grandma:  Her just getting out of the area is a good thing.  I don't know that em is necessary.  The facility is secured.  Court:  It sounds like the facility can serve the same monitory sevice.  Minsor feels the em is appropriate. Even just to get her to the facility.  She'll be out 2 days before.  Minser not sure what would happen after the program.  Court:  Modify bond while she's at the program.  Convert the bond back when she's done.  We can address bond then.  Belzer:  We can bring discharge papers in and show how well she's done.  Mom says she'sll be flying to CA with her.

Court comments and address' Abrianna.  The 10,000 cash bond will remain in effect.  Orders $5,000 cash bond on July 7th at 10 am.  JS monitoring while she's in La Crosse.  Take off em at 4 pm on July 8th.  She's to be in the company of a parent or grandparent until she's admitted to the facility.  The facility to notify us if she departs from the facility.  When she returns home, she's to be in the company of a parent or grandparent.  The $10,000 cash bond will be reinstated when she returns to La Crosse.  I'll also reinstate the $10,000 cash bond if she departs from the facility without approval.  The other conditions will remain in place except for any other JS conditions while she's in treatment.
Letter from Atty Belzer w/Attached information from Sovereign Health of California, filed.

Attornery's make arguments
CRT: CURRENT BOND WILL REMAIN - SHE WILL NOT BE RELEASED UNLESS SHE IS IN THE PROGRAM W/COND: I want a letter from the Director describing the monitoring services available and commit to notify the Court if there are any violations.
Calendar Call: 06-27-14 at 3:00pm
